column4: what of UNetBoot? is it too impractical for Peeco?
since I don't know that thing, I dunno
if you run it as a user it'll ask you to run as root
it's in /usr/sbin which is not in a user's path, only root's. so yes, just typing dpkg-reconfigure gives you command not found
/usr/sbin is in my path, I guess that only applies to the default account?
it shouldn't be in your user's path
but it is, and I don't recall tweaking it so hmm
there are hfs+ utils in ubuntu
